alert.note: Alert for Grant; Kay (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 5:11PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Kay and northern Grant Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 509 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking an outflow boundary from upstream severe thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southwest of Norwich to 6 miles west of Wellington to 4 miles northeast of Winfield. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. These winds will cross into northern Oklahoma between 530 and 600 PM. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Ponca City, Blackwell, Medford, Newkirk, Kaw City, Wakita, Braman, Deer Creek, Manchester, Kildare, Renfrow, Chilocco, Kaw Lake, Hardy, Nardin, Blackwell Lake, and Peckham. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 217 and 236. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
